Package com.array64.socialCredit.api

Interface SocialCreditSystem

public interface SocialCreditSystem
An API for the social credit system.

Methods ending in Async are asynchronous versions of their sync counterparts. It's recommended to use them if the sync method documents a warning for being blocking. These will return a CompletableFuture that will complete on the main thread with the sync method's return value.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Interface
    Description
    static enum 
    SocialCreditSystem.Visibility
    An enum to represent visibility of each player's social credit.

    • getScore

      int getScore(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      Parameters:
      player - The player to get the social credit score of
      Returns:
      The social credit score the player has
      See Also:

    • setScore

      void setScore(org.bukkit.entity.Player player, int score) throws ScoreOutOfBoundsException
      Sets player's social credit score to score.
      Parameters:
      player - The player to set the score of
      score - To score to be set
      Throws:
      ScoreOutOfBoundsException - if score is negative or greater than getConfig().getMaxScore()
      See Also:
      • getScore(Player)
      • changeScore(Player, int)

    • refreshAll

      void refreshAll()
      Refreshes all scores in the following ways:
      • Updates all visual indicators of social credit score from database.
      • Bounds the social credit score from 0 to the maximum possible score.
      • Updates permissions based on social credit score.
      • Updates database with bounded scores if any.

      This method's purpose is to update the scores of all players if scores or settings are out of sync.

      Warning: This method must be called on the main thread.

    • changeScore

      int changeScore(org.bukkit.entity.Player player, int scoreAdjust)
      Increases player's social credit score by scoreAdjust if scoreAdjust is non-negative. If scoreAdjust is negative, player's social credit score is decreased by -scoreAdjust.

      This method also ensures that player's social credit score will also be bounded between 0 and getConfig().getMaxScore() after changes.

      Parameters:
      player - The player to increase the score of
      scoreAdjust - The adjustment of the score
      Returns:
      The actual change in score, which can be different from scoreAdjust if the new social credit score was outside of the acceptable range and then bounded
      See Also:
      • setScore(Player, int)

    • setVisibility

      void setVisibility(org.bukkit.entity.Player player, SocialCreditSystem.Visibility visibility)
      Sets the visibility of player's social credit score.
      Parameters:
      player - The owner of the social credit score to set the visibility of
      visibility - The visibility to set the player's social credit score to
      See Also:
      • getVisibility(Player)

    • getVisibility

      SocialCreditSystem.Visibility getVisibility(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      Parameters:
      player - The owner of the social credit score to get the visibility of
      Returns:
      The visibility the player's social credit score has
      See Also:
      • setVisibility(Player, Visibility)

    • getConfig

      SocialCreditConfig getConfig()
      Returns:
      The social credit system's config. This config can be modified and will be saved automatically. However, some settings may need the use of refreshAll() to be put into effect.

    • addListener

      void addListener(SocialCreditListener listener)
      Registers a SocialCreditListener to the social credit system. Whenever certain events occur relating to the social credit system, they will be passed through each registered listener.
      Parameters:
      listener - The listener to be added

    • removeListener

      void removeListener(SocialCreditListener listener)
      Removes a SocialCreditListener from the social credit system if it's found. This means the listener will no longer receive events relating to the social credit system. Objects.equals(Object, Object) is used to determine if two listeners match.
      Parameters:
      listener - The listener to be removed

    • getTopScores

      Map<org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer,Integer> getTopScores(int numScores)
      Returns the map with the highest numScores scores. If there are less than numScores total scores registered, the map will return all registered scores.

      This map is iterated through in descending order of the players' scores.

      Warning: This method performs blocking operations. Use getTopScoresAsync(int) for the asynchronous version of this method.

      Parameters:
      numScores - The maximum number of scores to be retrieved
      Returns:
      A map with each key being a player mapped to their score

    • getBottomScores

      Map<org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer,Integer> getBottomScores(int numScores)
      Returns the map with the lowest numScores scores. If there are less than numScores total scores registered, the map will return all registered scores.

      This map is sorted in ascending order of the players' scores.

      Warning: This method performs blocking operations. Use getBottomScoresAsync(int) for the asynchronous version of this method.

      Parameters:
      numScores - The maximum number of scores to be retrieved
      Returns:
      A map with each key being a player mapped to their score

    • getTopScoresAsync

      CompletableFuture<Map<org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer,Integer>> getTopScoresAsync(int numScores)
      Async version of getTopScores(int). See SocialCreditSystem for more details about async methods.

    • getBottomScoresAsync

      CompletableFuture<Map<org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer,Integer>> getBottomScoresAsync(int numScores)
      Async version of getBottomScores(int). See SocialCreditSystem for more details about async methods.

    • setPermissionGate

      void setPermissionGate(String permission, int requiredScore) throws PermissionsNotAvailableException, ScoreOutOfBoundsException
      Creates a permission gate. This gate gives players with scores of at least requiredScore a permission using LuckPerms. It also takes away permissions from players with scores less than requiredScore.

      Whenever a player's score is set, a permission gate manages the player's access to its permission.

      If a gate already exists for permission, it is updated with the new requiredScore.

      Warning: This method requires the LuckPerms plugin to be installed on the server.

      Warning: Do not add or remove a permission for a player directly using LuckPerms if a permission gate is assigned to that player.

      Parameters:
      permission - The permission to be monitored
      requiredScore - The score required to get that permission
      Throws:
      PermissionsNotAvailableException - if LuckPerms is not installed on the server
      ScoreOutOfBoundsException - if requiredScore is negative or greater than getConfig().getMaxScore()

    • removePermissionGate

      void removePermissionGate(String permission) throws PermissionsNotAvailableException
      Removes the permission gate which monitors permission if there is one.

      Warning: This method requires the LuckPerms plugin to be installed on the server.

      Parameters:
      permission - The permission to no longer be monitored
      Throws:
      PermissionsNotAvailableException - if LuckPerms is not installed on the server
      See Also:
      • setPermissionGate(String, int)

    • getPermissionRequiredScore

      int getPermissionRequiredScore(String permission)
      Gets the social credit score required to have this LuckPerms permission. This is determined by permission gates.
      Parameters:
      permission - The permission being queried
      Returns:
      The minimum social credit score required to have this permission. If there isn't one, this method returns -1.
      See Also:
      • setPermissionGate(String, int)

    • getAllPermissionGates

      Map<String,Integer> getAllPermissionGates()
      Returns all permission gates in the form of a Map.

      Note: The map returned is a representation of the internal data. Modifying the map returned will not change the permission gates.

      Warning: This method performs blocking operations. Use for the asynchronous version of this method.

      Returns:
      A map with each key being a permission mapped to the minimum social credit score required to have it
      See Also:
      • setPermissionGate(String, int)

    • getAllPermissionGatesAsync

      CompletableFuture<Map<String,Integer>> getAllPermissionGatesAsync()
      Async version of getAllPermissionGates(). See SocialCreditSystem for more details about async methods.

    • hasPermissionsSupport

      boolean hasPermissionsSupport()
      Returns whether the plugin has access to LuckPerms. This is meant as an alternative to a try-catch block for permissions-related operations.
      Returns:
      true if the social credit system has access to LuckPerms, otherwise false
